About

The Seabase project is made possible by a grant from the Prince Albert II of Monaco Fondation.
Seasbase is a website using [gage](https://github.com/SpeciesFileGroup/gage), a configuration framework for producing "G"enomic "P"ages. It wraps [jBrowse 1](https://jbrowse.org/jbrowse1.html) and [SequenceServer](https://sequenceserver.com/) in website generated by a [Jekyl](https://jekyllrb.com/) wrapper. A build script faciliates data and metadata validation and staging.

Citing

This website

  • TESTING::Set in _config.yml - . Version generated on 22/11/18.

Component software

  • SequenceServer - Priyam et al. (2019) Sequenceserver: a modern graphical user interface for custom BLAST databases.
  • jBrowse (1.6.x) - Buels R et al. JBrowse: a dynamic web platform for genome visualization and analysis.Genome Biology (2016).

Gage

  • Gage is open source software, source is here.

Technical

These pages are built with Gage, a configuration framework for producing Genomic Pages.

The VAMPS project was made possible by grants from the Alfred P. Sloan Foundation, the G. Unger Vetlesen Foundation, the National Science Foundation, and the NASA Astrobiology Institute to Mitchell Sogin, David Mark Welch, and Susan Huse.
